solution_line_template: He walks {distance_house_to_school}m from home to school and walks {distance_house_to_school}m again from school to house, so he walks {distance_house_to_school}m + {distance_house_to_school}m = <<{distance_house_to_school}+{distance_house_to_school}={distance_round_trip_house_school}>>{distance_round_trip_house_school} meters

If the total distance is {total_distance_walked}m, the distance between the house and the market is {total_distance_walked}m - {distance_round_trip_house_school}m = <<{total_distance_walked}-{distance_round_trip_house_school}={distance_house_to_market}>>{distance_house_to_market} meters.
